maml:description.maml:para: Gets the fabric CDP policies. Cisco proprietory protocol. L2 protocol. Useful diagnotic aid, however has security issues. Beware !

dev:remarks.maml:para: name adminSt descr dn ---- ------- ----- -- default disabled uni/infra/cdpIfP-default enabled.cdp.pol enabled uni/infra/cdpIfP-enabled.cdp.pol disabled.cdp.pol disabled uni/infra/cdpIfP-disabled.cdp.pol

maml:description.maml:para: Get Fabric port channel polcies for multiple interface bundles.
Get Fabric port channel polcies for multiple interface bundles.

dev:remarks.maml:para: name mode ctrl minLinks maxLinks descr dn ---- ---- ---- -------- -------- ----- -- default off fast-sel-hot-stdby,graceful-conv,susp-individual 1 16 uni/infra/lacplagp-default active_nostandby.lacp.pol active fast-sel-hot-stdby,graceful-conv 1 16 uni/infra/lacplagp-active_nostandby.lacp.pol active.lacp.pol active fast-sel-hot-stdby,graceful-conv,susp-individual 1 16 uni/infra/lacplagp-active.lacp.pol static.lacp.pol off fast-sel-hot-stdby,graceful-conv,susp-individual 1 16 uni/infra/lacplagp-static.lacp.pol

Get Link Level policies for the ACI Fabric. These define speed, duplex, autoneg etc

dev:remarks.maml:para: name speed autoNeg descr dn ---- ----- ------- ----- -- default inherit on uni/infra/hintfpol-default 100G.auto.ll.pol 100G on uni/infra/hintfpol-100G.auto.ll.pol 1G.noauto.ll.pol 1G off uni/infra/hintfpol-1G.noauto.ll.pol

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the fabric LLDP policies. More standards based that CDP. L2 protocol. Useful diagnotic aid, however has security issues. Beware !

dev:remarks.maml:para: name adminRxSt adminTxSt descr dn ---- --------- --------- ----- -- default enabled enabled uni/infra/lldpIfP-default enabled.lldp.pol enabled enabled uni/infra/lldpIfP-enabled.lldp.pol enabled-tx.lldp.pol disabled enabled uni/infra/lldpIfP-enabled-tx.lldp.pol disabled.lldp.pol disabled disabled uni/infra/lldpIfP-disabled.lldp.pol

maml:alert.maml:para: pcEnfDir indicates the point Contacts and other policy control is applied. Usually on ingress (like ACL or Firewall ACL) pcEnfPref states whether contracts and other policy control are applied within this VRF. Usually enforced.

dev:remarks.maml:para: name descr bdEnforcedEnable pcEnfDir pcEnfPref dn ---- ----- ---------------- -------- --------- -- companyA-vrf no ingress enforced uni/tn-companyA/ctx-companyA-vrf secret no ingress enforced uni/tn-companyA/ctx-secret

maml:description.maml:para: Module for adding an AAA local user to ACI Fabric
Module for adding an AAA local user to ACI Fabric
Security Domain to add to. Usually something like 'all'
Security Privilage to grant. Usually 'writePriv' or 'readPriv'
Security Domain to add to. Usually something like 'all'
Security Privilage to grant. Usually 'writePriv' or 'readPriv'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-ACIAAALocalUser -Username admin2 -Password $SecureString -SecDomain all -SecRole admin -SecPriv writePriv

maml:description.maml:para: A module to make a RESTful API call to the Cisco ACI APIC infrastucture
A module to make a RESTful API call to the Cisco ACI APIC infrastucture
The HTTP method you wish to use, such as GET, POST, DELETE etc. Not all are supported by APIC
The encoding method used to communicate with the APIC
The specific URL to connect to
A blob of data (usually JSON) typically for a POST
The encoding method used to communicate with the APIC
The HTTP method you wish to use, such as GET, POST, DELETE etc. Not all are supported by APIC
A blob of data (usually JSON) typically for a POST
The specific URL to connect to
Create a new ACI App Profile
Create a new ACI App Profile
Create a new Bridge Domain for a given Tenant and VRF.
Create a new Bridge Domain for a given Tenant and VRF.
The L3out interface to associate the BD with.
The SVI interface is CIDR standard. Such as 10.0.0.1/8 or 172.16.32.65/28
This needs to be set to public (if you want the BD to be advertised and accessible externally) or private Function defaults to 'public'
The L3out interface to associate the BD with.
The SVI interface is CIDR standard. Such as 10.0.0.1/8 or 172.16.32.65/28
This needs to be set to public (if you want the BD to be advertised and accessible externally) or private Function defaults to 'public'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-ACIBD -Tenant dejungle -VRF amazon -BD 200-vcentre-drs-001 -L3out escapepod1 -SVI 3.3.3.1/28 -SVIscope public

Standby Uplinks in the order you wish, sepereated by commas
Whether to use Static or Dynamic VLAN

maml:description.maml:para: Function to add standard devices to individial switches
The switch object name to define the interfaces for. This can be found by using Get-ACIFabricSwitchLeaf
The specfic Leaf Interface Policy that has been already assigned to a leaf switch. Typically only one per switch is defined. This can be found using the Get-ACIFabricSwitchLeaf-IntProfiles
The name you want to call the group of interfaces.
The name you want to call the group of interfaces.
The specfic Leaf Interface Policy that has been already assigned to a leaf switch. Typically only one per switch is defined. This can be found using the Get-ACIFabricSwitchLeaf-IntProfiles
The switch object name to define the interfaces for. This can be found by using Get-ACIFabricSwitchLeaf

maml:alert.maml:para: Usually used for non multihomed servers, non LACP/VPC interfaces or managment ilo/cimc/drac connections

dev:remarks.maml:para: This adds port 39 - 41 to Leaf 102's interface selection policy and names it db.servers.fe.AccessPortSelector

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new VPC interface definition for a host and associate to the fabric.
We use the hostname, bondname and minidisc to create a unique identifier. These get stored in the format of 'hostname-bondname-minidesc'
Create a new VPC interface definition for a host and associate to the fabric.
We use the hostname, bondname and minidisc to create a unique identifier. These get stored in the format of 'hostname-bondname-minidesc'
The Leaf Switch name usually a VPC pair to associate with
The agregated interface name. For instance you could use use 'bond0', 'gec001' or similar
This is a short interface description. No spaces or funny chars. Use a project/service such as POC, PROD, YDC or similar
The AEEP which you want to associate the VPC with
Start Port number. Single numeric ie 1 or 48
The AEEP which you want to associate the VPC with
The agregated interface name. For instance you could use use 'bond0', 'gec001' or similar
Start Port number. Single numeric ie 1 or 48
This is a short interface description. No spaces or funny chars. Use a project/service such as POC, PROD, YDC or similar
The Leaf Switch name usually a VPC pair to associate with

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-ACIInterfaceVPC -hostname host099 -bondname bond0 -minidesc DevOpsLab -AEP vcentre.aeep -LinkLevel default -LACP LACP_active_nostandby -CDP default -LLDP default -Switch Leaf101-102_VPC_Profile -FromPort 5 -ToPort 8

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new L3out interface for a given Tenant
* THIS FUNCTION IS INCOMPLETE - It need to add SVI info, interface binding, contracts etc.... needs a lot more work*
Create a new L3out interface for a given Tenant

maml:alert.maml:para: This function currently returns raw data. This needs to be cleaned up. However if it does not error, it has worked !

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-ACIL3out -Tenant dejungle -VRF amazon -L3out escapepod1 -Description 'its the only way out'

maml:description.maml:para: A module to authenticate to Cisco ACI APIC infrastucture
A module to authenticate to Cisco ACI APIC infrastucture
The APIC you wish to connect to. Can be a hostname, FQDN or even IP address. HTTPS is always assumed.
The username to connect to the APIC with. Must be defined in ACI or downstream AAA as a valid user AND have access.
The password for the username specified.
(Optional) A location a hashed password is stored. This can be useful for automation tasks.
The APIC you wish to connect to. Can be a hostname, FQDN or even IP address. HTTPS is always assumed.
The password for the username specified.
(Optional) A location a hashed password is stored. This can be useful for automation tasks.
The username to connect to the APIC with. Must be defined in ACI or downstream AAA as a valid user AND have access.

maml:alert.maml:para: Check if an APIC was specified.
This function currently returns raw data. This needs to be cleaned up. However if it does not error, it has worked !

command:example.dev:code: New-ACITenant -Tenant dejungle -Description 'Its a nightmare out there'
